Articles.Content:
Hi all,

Having some trouble with my KSP install. Have trawled through the various forums and have found suggestions that come close to what I'm experiencing, but nothing that seems to solve the problem.

I'm running the latest version, 1.4.4, through Steam and with the Making History expansion installed. 

I'm also running several mods (list below), although not a staggering amount. I've installed them all directly and, as far as I'm aware, properly.

The game sticks when loading parts, specifically on air intakes. And it's not one part file that's corrupted - the game will freeze on whichever air intake part comes along first in the order. I've removed the mods one by one and run the game to see if the issue was with one particular file, but it sticks again, only this time on a different intake from a different pack. For instance, after removing Airplane Plus, it would then stick on the intakes included in B9. It even freezes on the squad intake parts, when I try to run a totally unmodded version of the game. 

I can't see a log file anywhere in the KSP_data folder, so unfortunately I can't show anything. 

Has anyone had any similar issues in the past? I struggled with the problem for a while, but then the game worked fine the other evening. Came back to it today and the same problem has flared up again. 

... I just wanna launch some space ships. Is it too much to ask? 

Thanks.

-SC

Mod List -

Airplane Plus, 22.0

B9, 6.3.2

Community Resource, 0.10.0.0

DMagic Orbital Science, 1.3.12

Docking Port Alignment Indicator, 6.8.2

Interstellar Fuel Switch, 3.6.1

Interstellar Extended, 1.19.3

KW Rocketry Rebalanced, 3.2.5.4

SCANsat, 18.6

Tweak Scale, 2.3.12

Universal Storage, 1.4.0

43 minutes ago, scarecrow2189 said:

I can't see a log file anywhere in the KSP_data folder, so unfortunately I can't show anything. 

If you haven't done before, please take a closer look at this post:

The post contains the two possible locations for your log file and we will definitly need one to help you.

Anyway, by looking at your mod list, I can already tell you that B9 6.3.2 is the wrong version (it's for ksp 1.3). You should update to the latest release:

Cheers.

B9 - Have now updated.

Please follow this link for the log. (I had often referred to the help post but only skim read. Rookie error.)

https://we.tl/ishfG1HnQc

Getting a 'null reference exception'... In the instance of this load up, it pertains to the mk1 intake from Airplane Plus, however it has also happened for other, similar parts, i.e. B9 aero intakes and even squad air scoops when attempting to run a mod-free version.

-SC

42 minutes ago, scarecrow2189 said:

B9 - Have now updated.

The dependencies as well? Firespitter is still listed as v. 7.3, the version bundled with the B9 core package is 7.9.0 .

44 minutes ago, scarecrow2189 said:

Getting a 'null reference exception'... In the instance of this load up, it pertains to the mk1 intake from Airplane Plus, however it has also happened for other, similar parts, i.e. B9 aero intakes and even squad air scoops when attempting to run a mod-free version.

Well, this sould not happen on a mod-free version...did you just remove the mods to test this or did you use a clean, fresh install through steam?

You can try to delete your 'ModuleManager.configcache' and other files named 'ModuleManager.xxx', except for the ModuleManager.dll.

Also, since the NullReferenceException (NRE) appears when KSP tries to create the drag cube, you can try to delete the 'PartDatabase.cfg', located in your KSP install directory. The file will be automatically recreated when you launch the game again.

B9 - Yes, all of the dependencies are now up to date. I think they are all bundled with the B9 Core pack but I've checked them anyway. 

And yes, I've been completely wiping my install and replacing it with a fresh one each time I've changed something. The error has been the same each time. Currently doing a fresh install again, so I'll put up the log from that once its done. 

- I'll also try your recommendations, thanks.

-SC

Edited July 17, 2018 by scarecrow2189

Please see below the link to another output log. 

https://we.tl/UlzCdte4vT

This is from a fresh install through Steam. Before the install I completely removed every trace of the former KSP folder in steamapps/common. 

The same issue is cropping up, hanging on the drag cube. 

I've noticed at the top of the file that the game is using my integrated intel graphics processor, instead of my Nvidia card. Could this be part of the problem? 

-SC

2 hours ago, scarecrow2189 said:

The same issue is cropping up, hanging on the drag cube. 

I've noticed at the top of the file that the game is using my integrated intel graphics processor, instead of my Nvidia card. Could this be part of the problem? 

That's odd...both things.

If the GPU is used to create drag cubes, it can be indeed part of your problem. I didn't know that it is possible to use both, an IGP and a dedicated GPU at the same time, so after a quick google search, I can find two solutions:

1) There is a chance, that you can right-click the KSP_64.exe to find a menu which allows you to choose between both graphics processors. Something like 'execute with graphics processor...' or similar.

2) If you actually don't need the IGP, deactivate it in your bios/uefi (at least, this should be fine to test)

I'm actually curious what will happen if I activate my IGP...

Morning (Or good day, wherever you are in the world). 

Regarding the GPU - I have my Nvidia card set as my default through my Nvidia control software, however KSP still doesn't seem to use it. 

I actually seem to have resolved the issue with a fresh install of Steam. I then installed KSP and all the aforementioned mods on my local SSD, instead of an external HDD. It's worked on the HDD plenty of times in the past, but either this or the fresh install of Steam looks to have fixed it. 

This is the story of my life - I always seem to the get the most bizarre problems with things, be it my computer or my car... I'm always the one pushing the boundaries of what has come to be expected... It's a curse. 

I'd rather not test the two options you've given now, seeing as the game is working. Is there anything you'd suggest though in terms of providing information for others who might stumble across the same issue? I might just have to edit my top post with my solution, as head-scratchingly frustrating as it is...

-SC

1 hour ago, scarecrow2189 said:

Is there anything you'd suggest though in terms of providing information for others who might stumble across the same issue? I might just have to edit my top post with my solution, as head-scratchingly frustrating as it is... ﻿

You can also use the checkmark symbol on  the left of your post to mark your own answer as 'best answer'. This will push the post to the second position, so everyone can see the question and solution with ease.

Nothing else I can say about the topic, it's such a rare phenomenom.

Well thanks for your help anyway! Much appreciated!

I'll post again here with a fresh log if the same issue crops up. 

Happy flying!

-SC
